item.title: eHandbook for the tanks
item.dc:creator: wordpress4
item.description: About the Author Chris F Foss has been writing on armoured fighting vehicles and artillery systems since 1970 and has written and edited well over 60 books on this and allied subjects including air defence systems. He has also edited a major defence magazine and contributed on a wide range of land based weapon systems to countless magazines world wide. Besides lecturing on AFVs around the world Foss has also driven well over 40 tracked and wheeled armoured vehicles and chaired a number of major defence conferences on armoured fighting vehicles and artillery systems. He is married with 3 grown up children.
item.content:encoded:
Since the publication of the first edition in 1996, Jane’s Tanks Recognition Guide has been the most authoritative and comprehensive military vehicle handbook available. This new edition maintains this high standard with complete coverage of every tank and AFV in use today.

Janes Tanks and Combat Vehicles Recognition Guide is a fully illustrated encyclopaedia of all modern military vehicles in service today. It includes tanks, personnel carriers, reconnaissance vehicles, self-propelled guns and self-propelled anti-aircraft systems.

This book features:
• Technical data for over 200 vehicles
• Recognition features
• Line drawings
• Over 1000 photographs

This fully-updated third edition features colour photography, making it much easier to distinguish key features of the vehicles.

Technical information includes: Specifications, Development of the design, Variants, Status of production, Manufacturer’s details and key recognition details.

This new edition comes in a handy size, and its new format is user friendly, allowing for an even greater range of vehicles and additional information to be included.

item.title: Ticket on the presentation of the Abrams-X
item.dc:creator: wordpress4
item.description: The Abrams X is a technology demonstrator tank unveiled in October 2022, a transition stage between the M1A2 SEPv3 and SEPv4 to the US Army's next-generation tank.
item.content:encoded:
The Abrams X is a technology demonstrator tank unveiled in October 2022, a transition stage between the M1A2 SEPv3 and SEPv4 to the US Army’s next-generation tank.
The tank is said to have a reduced weight and a deserted turret with a new gun, autoloader, a turret with a Kongsberg Protector RS6 30mm gun. Due to the hybrid power plant, the power can be adjusted from 750 to 1,500 hp, while the tank will consume 50% less fuel for the same operational radius as serial tanks, and will also have the ability to move quietly at low speeds and sound masking. The car is equipped with cameras with a 360° view, a complex of active protection Trophy and has elements of artificial intelligence.
